h3.a: UPDATES from the Superintendent Regarding the Closure and Distance Learning

div.span: Following the Governors announcement on April 9, all schools in the West Shore School District will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Extracurricular, athletic events/practices, and after-school events will be cancelled during this same timeframe.

With the most recent stay-at-home orders issued by the Governor and the likelihood that our entire community will be included in those orders soon, the District wants to reinforce the importance of adhering to the restrictions and recommendations given by government agencies about gatherings of groups of people and maintaining social distancing.

The West Shore School District will offer Free Grab-and-Go Bagged Meals for all children from 11 a.m. till 1p.m., Monday through Friday, at four designated locations. Lunch for that day and breakfast for the following day will be included in each bag. Similar to the summer meal program, all children 18 and younger are welcome to participate. No questions will be asked.

h3.a: POSTPONED: Cedar Cliff's Production of Into the Woods

div.span: As previously shared, due to the closure of schools and to ensure the safety of students, staff, and the community, Cedar Cliff High School's Spring Musical Into The Woods has been postponed until further notice.

Coming to District mail boxes the first week of March, Points of Pride! We hope youll take afew minutes to flip through its pages for updates on District initiatives, including afeature article on our DaVinci program. There are lots of reasons why we are #WestShoreProud and we look forward to sharing them with you.
Mission Transition is a free program offering children who are entering kindergarten in August 2020 with the opportunity to develop social skills while exploring beginning literacy and math concepts.

span.title: Article Title: On Board - March 2020 Issue

div.span: On Board is published monthly after the study sessions and Board meetings have been held. It provides asummary of Board discussions and actions as well as shout outs and recognitions presented by the Board and administration. To view the most recent, please click here. Alink can also be found on the School Board page.

We received more than 560 responses to our calendar survey this year. After careful review of the comments, concerns, and questions received, one change to the proposed calendar was made; November 30, will be anon-school day, and in exchange, April 1, will be astudent day. Additional information regarding this change and answers to other frequently asked questions can be found by clicking theMore + link.

span.div: During the Board Meeting on Thursday, September 19, 2019, the Feasibility Committee, in conjunction with RLPS Architects, presented an update on the Feasibility Study. We are very pleased to share these updates and hope that you can feel the excitement is building. Click here!

h3.a: 3D Preview of the New Rossmoyne Elementary

div.span: The District is very pleased to share acompleted 3D rendering of the new Rossmoyne Elementary School. We are thrilled to see the conversations and feedback collected from administrators, students, parents, teachers, and the community come to life in this video. As you watch, we hope you will share in our pride and excitement. Our goal (pending final permits and asmooth construction process) is to open the building for the 2020-2021 school year!

source.p: To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

div.span:
In January, after PDE released its Future Ready Index for the 2018-2019 school year, we as aDistrict reflected on our measures of success as well. We invite you to take afew minutes to join us in looking back on last school year and the many reasons we are #WestShoreProud!
Special thanks to the following students for participating in this year's video (in order of appearance): Lola Williams, Talan Shultz, Kaylee Kramer, Keith Williams, Raegan Buxton, Jocelyn Heredia, and Connor McCullough. Additionally, to Dr. Whye, Assistant Superintendent, for gathering data and narrating.

b.span: We are committed to providing students with inspiring andrelevant experiences sothey may live meaningful,purposeful,and impactful lives.
